item.title: Support people facing COVID-19
item.description: If you are experiencing medical emergency, call 911. If you need someone to talk to, you can call any of us. We are here for you. We are NOT healthcare providers. But we are healthy, with technology, and going to try to help you: Take your call, facetime, and text ~24/7 Answer your questions Link you with your local support system Connect you with a healthy person nearby Order you food Ship you things Just let us know how we can help you.

item.title: Kate
item.description: Kate Medetgul-Ernar I do hardcore genomics. Craft Genomics Education 201209 - 201606 BS, Biochemistry @ University of California, San Diego Work 201405 - 201410 Kristina Bostrom Lab @ UCLA Cardiology 201309 - 201605 Trey Ideker Lab @ UCSD Medicine 201506 - Present Cofounder @ Guardiome 201605 - Present Computational Cancer Analysis Laboratory @ UCSD Moores Cancer Center

item.title: Kwat
item.description: Kwat Medetgul-Ernar (Huwate Yeerna) I code, compute, and model various diseases. I want to heal people with cancer. Craft Computational Mathematics Informatics Medicine Education 201109 - 201606 BS, Bioinformatics & Bioengineering @ University of California, San Diego 201908 - Present MD, Medicine @ Stanford University 202108 - Present PhD, Biophysics @ Stanford University Work 201006 - 201109 & 201406 - 201409 Kristina Bostrom Lab @ UCLA Cardiology

item.title: Work
item.description: We want to help kids with cancer. What happens when a child gets cancer? (Event 1 kid) e1k. A kid gets cancer. (Event 1 doctor) e1d. The kid’s doctor must characterize the cancer to plan treatment. e2k. The kid gets the treatment. e2d. The doctor must monitor and adjust the treatment. The kid may not respond well to or tolerate the treatment, and not make it. When the kid makes it:
